jobDescription: Manager of UX – SMB The Manager of UX is both a principal hands-on Interaction Designer, senior Problem Solver and Design Thinker as well as a manager of Small Business Unit (SMB) User Experience Design team. As a member of the UX Design team, you are responsible for the UX design of the NETGEAR user interface, primarily focused on interaction design and problem solving. Principal Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to:Manage team executing and assigning/reviewing tasks across a specific domain areaManage collaboration with designers and Product Managers to define UX goals of the assigned areaEstablish UX Strategy for products and communicate that across to designers and product teamsManage teams’ original designs for different platforms and environments, striving for a consistent user experience across all touch pointsManage the creation of new templates, styleguide, documentation and design principlesManage development of scenarios, wireframes, and mock-ups/prototypes in order to evaluate and communicate design thinkingMentors junior members toward improved understanding of design process, domain, and improved capacity/efficiencyConsistently demonstrate innovative thinking when managing design processManage design cohesion across multiple product linesQualifications:Bachelor's degree or equivalent industry experience (7+ years)Has extensive experience designing compelling and quality UI, Interaction and visual designKeep up to date with the state of the art of UX design, new technologies and behavior trendsHas high capacity to create excellent UX and interaction design in a timely mannerExcellent skills with industry-standard design softwareReviews work of other designers and provides constructive feedbackHas deep understanding of underlying technology (HTML5, CSS, etc…) and relevant products in their assigned areaAbility to mentor others in domain knowledgeAbility to lead and facilitate design workshopsDesired Experience:Prior experience working within a technical environment is requiredInterest in emerging technologies in web, mobile, and other devices is requiredFamiliarity with the agile software development process is strongly preferredKnowledge of Networking business and industries is a huge plus
